item.title: New in SpyWeek: Frog Poison Killed Navalny, More Gabbard-Russia, Havana Syndrome test, Covert Action in Iran
item.description: Also: Bondi on domestic terrorism, Russian and Chinese agents jailed, AI in the Maduro raid, more

item.title: ‘An Existential Question for Europe’
item.description: The Munich Security Conference ends with no new answers on how to end the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Dubai’s crazy rich Chinese
item.description: Scrutinised at home and in the West, Chinese money is moving into the Gulf

item.title: Donald Trump’s schemes to juice the economy
Checks and Balance: The death of the “endangerment finding”
item.description: John Prideaux, our US editor, says the rollback of climate regulation reveals a deeper story about American governance

item.title: Rubio’s Silk-Stocking Diplomacy
item.description: The future that the US Secretary of State touted at this year’s Munich Security Conference is not a vision of something to be built. It is the past projected forward, sugar-coating its racism with appeals to the shared “Christian faith” and “ancestry” that supposedly define the transatlantic bond.

item.title: Cover Story newsletter: The most powerful woman in the world
item.description: An exclusive look at how we designed this week’s covers

item.title: Why MAGA brands have been a flop
item.description: Conservatives are better at trashing businesses than building them

item.title: The battle to save South America’s skull-crushing big cat
item.description: Farmers and villagers realise that jaguars are worth more alive than dead

item.title: India’s pollution is becoming an economic roadblock
item.description: The government’s inaction runs counter to its goals
